TopicTitle: radial chute cannot deploy while stowed

Articles.Content:
Using a rocket that I used several times before without any problem, I set in the de-orbiting maneuver with confidence. Coming in at a nice 20 degree angle with a velocity of aprox. 2300 m/s. Re-entry without a problem, ready to deploy the chutes at a true altitude of 2500 m - speed 210 m/ and ... chutes fail to open; bye Jeb. It has worked fine before and absolutely nothing has been changed to the design of the rocket.

Message: radial chute cannot deploy while stowed

What happened?

Edited May 6, 2015 by Galileo Kerbonaut

Using a rocket that I used several times before without any problem, I set in the de-orbiting maneuver with confidence. Coming in at a nice 20 degree angle with a velocity of aprox. 2300 m/s. Re-entry without a problem, ready to deploy the chutes at a true altitude of 2500 m - speed 210 m/ and ... chutes fail to open; bye Jeb. It has worked fine before and absolutely nothing has been changed to the design of the rocket.

Message: radial chute cannot deploy while stowed

What happened?

this happened to me once when my radial chutes were a bit too close to another part. I think KSP thinks the chute inside (occluded) in another part. Is that possibly what happened?

I had this happen when the radial chute was just touching the outside of a service module. It seems that the game thought the chute was inside the service module and, therefore, stowed. Open the service module doors and the chute will deploy.

There is indeed a service module beneath the chutes, but the chutes themselves are mounted on the MK1. I replaced them just a little higher and now they're working fine.

Good to know for rocket future builds.
Yeah the Service Module is the culprit. If the message occurs, open the bay and everything will work. I guess the message is answered

I wish I knew how I can change the status.

I can land and take off from Eve, but I don't know how to use the forum

I wish I knew how I can change the status.

I can land and take off from Eve, but I don't know how to use the forum

there is a stickied forum thread devoted to changed unanswered to answered.
As a note I have found the same thing happens with the solar panels as well. I had them to close to thw service bay and they wouldn't open till a hard landing on Mun shook them a bit.

there is a stickied forum thread devoted to changed unanswered to answered.

Thanks for pointing it out. Never saw that before
